pull_request.title: Update Picnic to 3.0.7
pull_request.body:
This PR updates the Picnic copy to version 3.0.7. Additionally, it slightly reduces the diff between our code and the copy in liboqs by providing a code path for calling `OQS_randombytes` in `randomness.c` and by defining `PICNIC_EXPORT` instead of `PICNIC_STATIC`. `PICNIC_STATIC` is intended for the static build for tests and benchmarking and is intended as an internal flag. With these changes future imports of the Picnic code base should be a bit smoother and should only require a check that `oqs_picnic_macros.h` is still included in the correct places.

* [x] Does this PR change the input/output behaviour of a cryptographic algorithm (i.e., does it change known answer test values)?  (If so, a version bump will be required from *x.y.z* to *x.(y+1).0*.): It doesn't.
* [x] Does this PR change the the list of algorithms available -- either adding, removing, or renaming?  (If so, PRs in OQS-OpenSSL, OQS-BoringSSL, and OQS-OpenSSH will also be required by the time this is merged.): It doesn't.

review.body:
`main` branch build of shared lib: output of `$ readelf --wide --segments -- lib/liboqs.so`:

```
Elf-Datei-Typ ist DYN (geteilte Objektadatei)
Entry point 0xc2f0
There are 8 program headers, starting at offset 64

Programm-Header:
  Typ            Offset   VirtAdr            PhysAdr            DateiGr  SpeiGr   Flg Ausr.
  LOAD           0x000000 0x0000000000000000 0x0000000000000000 0x7dc508 0x7dc508 R E 0x200000
  LOAD           0x7dc7b0 0x00000000009dc7b0 0x00000000009dc7b0 0x002538 0x0025e8 RW  0x200000
  DYNAMIC        0x7dd2c0 0x00000000009dd2c0 0x00000000009dd2c0 0x0001f0 0x0001f0 RW  0x8
  NOTE           0x000200 0x0000000000000200 0x0000000000000200 0x000024 0x000024 R   0x4
  TLS            0x7dc7b0 0x00000000009dc7b0 0x00000000009dc7b0 0x000000 0x000008 R   0x4
  GNU_EH_FRAME   0x77f7f8 0x000000000077f7f8 0x000000000077f7f8 0x00c42c 0x00c42c R   0x4
  GNU_STACK      0x000000 0x0000000000000000 0x0000000000000000 0x000000 0x000000 RWE 0x10
  GNU_RELRO      0x7dc7b0 0x00000000009dc7b0 0x00000000009dc7b0 0x001850 0x001850 R   0x1

 Abbildung von Sektion nach Segment:
  Segmentsektionen...
   00     .note.gnu.build-id .gnu.hash .dynsym .dynstr .gnu.version .gnu.version_r .rela.dyn .rela.plt .init .plt .plt.got .text .fini .rodata .eh_frame_hdr .eh_frame 
   01     .init_array .fini_array .data.rel.ro .dynamic .got .got.plt .data .bss 
   02     .dynamic 
   03     .note.gnu.build-id 
   04     .tbss 
   05     .eh_frame_hdr 
   06     
   07     .init_array .fini_array .data.rel.ro .dynamic .got
```

Same command run on `ds-noexecstack`:

```
Elf-Datei-Typ ist DYN (geteilte Objektadatei)
Entry point 0xc2f0
There are 8 program headers, starting at offset 64

Programm-Header:
  Typ            Offset   VirtAdr            PhysAdr            DateiGr  SpeiGr   Flg Ausr.
  LOAD           0x000000 0x0000000000000000 0x0000000000000000 0x7dc508 0x7dc508 R E 0x200000
  LOAD           0x7dc7b0 0x00000000009dc7b0 0x00000000009dc7b0 0x002538 0x0025e8 RW  0x200000
  DYNAMIC        0x7dd2c0 0x00000000009dd2c0 0x00000000009dd2c0 0x0001f0 0x0001f0 RW  0x8
  NOTE           0x000200 0x0000000000000200 0x0000000000000200 0x000024 0x000024 R   0x4
  TLS            0x7dc7b0 0x00000000009dc7b0 0x00000000009dc7b0 0x000000 0x000008 R   0x4
  GNU_EH_FRAME   0x77f7f8 0x000000000077f7f8 0x000000000077f7f8 0x00c42c 0x00c42c R   0x4
  GNU_STACK      0x000000 0x0000000000000000 0x0000000000000000 0x000000 0x000000 RWE 0x10
  GNU_RELRO      0x7dc7b0 0x00000000009dc7b0 0x00000000009dc7b0 0x001850 0x001850 R   0x1

 Abbildung von Sektion nach Segment:
  Segmentsektionen...
   00     .note.gnu.build-id .gnu.hash .dynsym .dynstr .gnu.version .gnu.version_r .rela.dyn .rela.plt .init .plt .plt.got .text .fini .rodata .eh_frame_hdr .eh_frame 
   01     .init_array .fini_array .data.rel.ro .dynamic .got .got.plt .data .bss 
   02     .dynamic 
   03     .note.gnu.build-id 
   04     .tbss 
   05     .eh_frame_hdr 
   06     
   07     .init_array .fini_array .data.rel.ro .dynamic .got 
```

--> Not an awful lot changed: The "E" markings are still there (which shouldn't be the case if I read https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/issues/1159#issue-1084234445 correctly). And indeed, this command lets the "E" vanish from the GNU_STACK flags: `cmake -GNinja -DCMAKE_ASM_FLAGS=-Wa,--noexecstack -DBUILD_SHARED_LIBS=ON ..`. So I'm afraid the PR doesn't cut it yet.

pull_request.title: Add support for powerpc64
pull_request.body:
<!-- Please give a brief explanation of the purpose of this pull request. -->
﻿This is 64-bit POWER big-endian. Since s390x (64-bit big-endian) and ppc64le
(64-bit POWER) are already supported, this shouldn't be an issue.
This PR adds support for 64-bit POWER on big-endian.
There is already support for one 64-bit big-endian architecture (s390x).
There is also support for ppc64le (64-bit POWER little-endian).
So this PR shouldn't add much overhead.

<!-- Please answer the following questions to help manage version and changes across projects. -->

* [ ] Does this PR change the input/output behaviour of a cryptographic algorithm (i.e., does it change known answer test values)?  (If so, a version bump will be required from *x.y.z* to *x.(y+1).0*.)
* [ ] Does this PR change the the list of algorithms available -- either adding, removing, or renaming?  (If so, PRs in OQS-OpenSSL, OQS-BoringSSL, and OQS-OpenSSH will also be required by the time this is merged.)

<!-- Once your pull request is ready for review and passing continuous integration tests, please convert from a draft PR to a normal PR, and request a review from one of the OQS core team members. -->
